category: Safety and Health Management Regulations/Article 25 (Suspension of Work)
contents: Article 25 (Suspension of work) ① When there is an imminent risk of an industrial accident or a serious accident occurs, the chairman must immediately stop work and take necessary safety and health measures, such as evacuating workers from the work site. ② If there is an imminent risk of an industrial accident occurring, workers may stop work and evacuate. ③ Workers who stop work and evacuate pursuant to paragraph 2 shall report the fact to a supervisor or safety and health worker without delay. It must be reported to the person in charge (hereinafter referred to as *Management Supervisor, etc.)., ④ Upon receipt of the report pursuant to paragraph 3, the Management Supervisor, etc. must take necessary measures regarding safety and health., ⑤ The Chairman shall report to the person in charge (hereinafter referred to as *Management Supervisor, etc.) When there are reasonable grounds to believe that there is a risk, workers who have stopped work and evacuated in accordance with paragraph 1 shall not be dismissed or treated unfavorably for this reason. ⑥ Details regarding work stoppage measures and procedures shall be provided by the chairman. Decide separately.
